narrative.title: Scene 5-3 — The Blanket Tug
paragraphs: The crawlies fight halfheartedly; they care more about stealing. Theadora raises her voice to declare that nothing should be taken. Two crawlies slip back under the bed with small things.

Then one tries to drag the baby blanket below. Flops dives to grab a corner and slides across the floor. Stitch catches her legs while Theadora and Lumpy push against the bed. The blanket begins to move toward them, but a sudden pull breaks their hold. The stuffies tumble into the purple space under the bed.

vocabulary.definition: Without much effort or real interest.
examples: He cleaned halfheartedly and missed the corners.
They cheered halfheartedly after the loss.

vocabulary.definition: To say something clearly and strongly.
To move quietly or easily back to a place.
examples: The cat will slip back into the garden.
We slip back before anyone sees us.

vocabulary.definition: To pull something along the ground.
examples: They drag the box across the floor.

vocabulary.definition: A warm cover used on a bed.
examples: The baby reached for the blanket.

vocabulary.definition: To take hold of something quickly and firmly.
examples: Grab my hand before you fall.
He tried to grab the last seat.

events.text: The crawlies fight halfheartedly, focusing on stealing items.
“Don’t let them take a single thing!” Theadora declares.
Two crawlies slip back under the bed with small objects.
Flops spots a crawly dragging the baby blanket.
Flops dives and grabs a corner; she begins to slide across the floor.
Stitch holds Flops’s legs; Theadora and Lumpy pile on and brace against the bed.
They start pulling the blanket out; then a great tug rips them free of the bed.
All four are yanked into the purple unknown; the girl shivers in her sleep.

distractors: Theadora declares they should take everything.
Two crawlies slip back into the closet with small objects.
Flops spots a crawly dragging the baby pillow.
